intro: Rumex rheifolius, commonly known as the narrow-leaf dock, is a flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist or wet habitats such as marshes, meadows, and stream banks. The plant has alternate, lanceolate leaves with a distinctive waxy coating and prominent veins. Its small, greenish flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences, and it produces small, round fruits known as achenes. Rumex rheifolius is often found in temperate regions and is adapted to thrive in nutrient-rich soils.
